summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorneys discussing Jeffrey Epstein's guilty plea. The emails express surprise and satisfaction at the plea, with one attorney crediting another for ensuring Epstein did not 'get away with it.'

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the emails; described as having pled guilty, with one attorney referring to him as 'my nemesis.'

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: An individual who informed one of the email authors about Epstein's guilty plea.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pled guilty to charges, as reported in the email chain.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pled guilty, an event that surprised the prosecutors involved.
One U.S. Attorney credits another for the plea, stating 'If it had not been for you, he would have gotten away with it.'
The correspondence reveals internal satisfaction among prosecutors regarding the outcome.
The emails are dated July 1, 2008, providing a timeline for reactions to the plea.
The document is an internal email chain between U.S. Attorneys, indicating official communication about the case.
